Here's an example, from_numpy takes 757 ms on my machine for 1GB numpy array. It seems there's a copy happening somewhere although I'm confused where since I don't see any calls to memcpy in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp#L91-L124

import numpy as np
import time
import torch

start_time = time.time()
arr = np.zeros((1000*250*1000,))
arr.flags['WRITEABLE'] = False
start_time = time.time()
arr2 = torch.from_numpy(arr)
print("%.1f ms "%((time.time()-start_time)*1000,))  # ==> 757.8 ms

Here's an example, `from_numpy` takes 757 ms on my machine for 1GB numpy array. It seems there's a copy happening somewhere although I'm confused where since I don't see any calls to memcpy in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/utils/tensor_numpy.cpp#L91-L124


```
import numpy as np
import time
import torch

start_time = time.time()
arr = np.zeros((1000*250*1000,))
arr.flags['WRITEABLE'] = False
start_time = time.time()
arr2 = torch.from_numpy(arr)
print("%.1f ms "%((time.time()-start_time)*1000,))  # ==> 757.8 ms 
```
